course_format: Duration of the course is 4 academic hours.
The course includes approximately 40% hands on lab work.
objectives: To be able to set up a Continuous Integration environment using Travis-CI
prerequisites: Basic programming background in either a high-level language such as C, Java or a scripting language such as Shell, VBSscript, Javascript, Perl, Python, PHP or Ruby
Experience with a text editor like emacs, vi, pico or notepad.

entries: Create a an (almost) empty GitHub repository
syllabus.title: Travis-CI on empty repository

entries: Create a simple application in Python (and other languages as requested by the audience)
Configure Travis to run the test
syllabus.title: Travis-CI for an application

entries: Testing Matrix using multiple programming languages
Setting up single test environment with multiple languages
syllabus.title: Travis-CI using multiple languages

target_audience: This course is for programmers and DevOps or Test Automation engineers who would like to use CI for their GitHub-based project.
title: Continuous Integration with Travis-CI
